Title: Double-page Illuminated Frontispiece
Medium: ink, paint, and gold on thin laid paper
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.563 is the right side of a double-page illuminated frontispiece, decorated with a large circular medallion (shamsah) surrounded by 4 roundels. The area within the frame and the margins contains explanations of the number of readings in various chapters according to various reciters.
Keywords: Koran; Qur`an; Arabic; Islamic; Persian; Timurid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Manuscript; Medallion; Original Binding; India; Central Asia; Scripture
Provenance: Sultan 'Uthman Khan [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [erased bequest (waqf) statement and stamp on fol. 3a]; Sultan Bayezid II [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [seal on fol. 8a]; Dikran Kelekian, New York and Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date of acquisition unknown] by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Indian
